Wisdom: الْمُذْنِبُ عَلَى بَصِيرَةٍ غَيْرُ مُسْتَحِقٍّ لِلْعَفْوِ
إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَسْتَسْهِلَ رُكُوبَ الْمَعَاصِي فَإِنَّهَا تَكْسُوكَ فِي الدُّنْيَا ذِلَّةً وَتُكْسِبُكَ فِي الْآخِرَةِ سَخَطَ اللَّهِ
enWisdom: Do not take the committing of vices lightly, for verily it will cover you with humiliation in this world and earn you the wrath of Allah in the Hereafter

Wisdom: أَلَا وَإِنَّ الْخَطَايَا خَيْلٌ شُمُسٌ حُمِلَ عَلَيْهَا أَهْلُهَا وَخُلِعَتْ لُجُمُهَا فَأَوْرَدَتْهُمُ النَّارَ
enWisdom: Verily wrongdoings are [like] wild horses that carry their riders on their backs while their bridles have been thrown off, so they take them [straight] into the fire of hell

Wisdom: إِنَّكَ إِنْ حَارَبْتَ اللَّهَ حُرِبْتَ وَهَلَكْتَ
enWisdom: Indeed, if you fight against Allah, you will be defeated and destroyed
Through disobedience [to Allah] the [gate of] hellfire is closed for the aberrant [and they are unable to escape it]
How evil an action disobedience [to Allah] is!
The outcome of sins is loss [and destruction]
Many a great sin of yours is deemed by you as [being] small
Submission to sin is the trait of the doomed

Wisdom: لِلْمُجْتَرِئِ عَلَى الْمَعَاصِي نِقَمٌ مِنْ عَذَابِ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: If Allah, the Glorified, had not forbidden that which He has ordained as unlawful, it would have [still] been mandatory for the intelligent one to keep away from it
One who does not restrain himself [from evils and excesses] is ignorant

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ فِكْرُهُ فِي اللَّذَّاتِ غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: One who thinks a lot about [worldly] pleasures is overpowered by them

Wisdom: مَنْ تَلَذَّذَ بِمَعَاصِي اللَّهِ أَوْرَثَهُ اللَّهُ ذُلًّا
enWisdom: One whose sins increase, his disparagement becomes necessary
Neither are blessings taken away from you nor are you deprived of any comforts of life but because of the sins that you commit, and Allah is not unjust to the Servants

Wisdom: مَا ظَفِرَ مَنْ ظَفِرَ الْإِثْمُ بِهِ
enWisdom: He who has been vanquished by sin has not gained victory

Wisdom: مُدْمِنُ الشَّهَوَاتِ صَرِيعُ الْآفَاتِ مُقَارِنُ السَّيِّئَاتِ مُوقِنٌ بالسبات [بِالتَّبِعَاتِ‏]
enWisdom: One who makes a habit of following [his] lustful desires is overwhelmed by afflictions, is associated with evils and has certainty about the permanence [of this world]
